original_title: 3D Printed Axial Compressor is On a Mission to Inflate Balloons
original_content:
[Lets Print] has been fascinated with creating a 3D printed axial compressor that can do meaningful work, and his latest iteration mixes FDM and SLA printed parts to successfully inflate (and pop) a latex glove, so thats progress!
Originally, the unit couldnt manage even that until he modified the number and type of fan blades on the compressor stages. There were other design challenges as well. For example, one regular issue was a coupling between the motor and the rest of the unit breaking repeatedly. At the speeds the compressor runs at, weak points tend to surface fairly quickly. Thats not stopping [Lets Print], however. He plans to explore other compressor designs in his quest for an effective unit.
Attaching motor shafts to 3D printed devices can be tricky, and in the past weve seen a clever solution that is worth keeping in mind: half of a spider coupling (or jaw coupling) can be an economical and effective way to attach 3D printed things to a shaft.
While blowing up a regular party balloon is still asking too much of [Lets Print]s compressor as it stands, it certainly inflates (and pops) a latex glove like nobodys business.
title: ハイブリッド3Dプリントで実現する意義ある作業のための軸圧縮機の開発
body: 3D印刷の軸流圧縮機を作る試みが進展。ファンブレードの修正や耐久性の向上が課題。モーターとの結合部の問題も解決。様々なデザインを試し、効果的な機械にする予定。モーター軸との結合が難しいが、蜘蛛型カップリングが有効。パーティーバルーンにはまだ対応できないが、ラテックスの手袋は膨らむ。
titles: ハイブリッド3Dプリントで実現する意義ある作業のための軸圧縮機の開発
モーターとユニットの結合部が破断する問題を解決した3Dプリント圧縮機の改良
3Dプリントデバイスへのモーターシャフトの取り付けにおけるトリッキーな問題解決
効果的な圧縮機を探求するための異なるデザインの試み
ラテックス手袋を膨らませることに成功した2種類の3Dプリント技術を組み合わせた圧縮機
